question.text: Whether or not a person achieves their aims in life is mostly related to luck. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

questionType.explanation: You must state how strongly you agree or disagree with the statement that success is mostly due to luck. You can strongly agree, strongly disagree, partially agree, or take a balanced position.
requirements: State your position clearly in the introduction
Support your position with logical arguments
Consider the opposing view briefly (optional but recommended for balance)

keyWords.definition: Successfully accomplishes their goals or objectives
keyWords.importance: This is what the essay is measuring - success in life

keyWords.definition: Primarily caused by or connected to
keyWords.importance: Key qualifier - the essay asks if luck is the MAIN factor

keyWords.definition: Success or failure apparently brought by chance rather than effort
keyWords.importance: One side of the debate - random chance vs. personal effort

keyWords.definition: How much or to what degree
keyWords.importance: You can agree completely, partially, or disagree - show nuance

essayStructure.introduction: 2-3 sentences: Paraphrase question + state your position clearly
essayStructure.body1: 4-5 sentences: Present your main argument (either luck matters OR hard work matters)
essayStructure.body2: 4-5 sentences: Present counterargument or additional supporting points
essayStructure.conclusion: 2 sentences: Summarize your position + final thought

commonMistakes: Being too neutral - you need a clear position
Discussing only one side without acknowledging the other
Using 'I think' or 'In my opinion' too frequently
Copying words directly from the question without paraphrasing

structure.introduction: It is often argued that [restate the statement]. I strongly disagree with this view because [brief reason].
structure.body1: The primary reason I disagree is that [main argument]. [Explanation]. For instance, [specific example]. This clearly demonstrates [conclusion].
structure.body2: Furthermore, [second argument]. While [acknowledge luck's role], [counter this with effort's importance]. For example, [supporting example].
structure.conclusion: In conclusion, [restate position]. [Final thought on why effort matters more than luck].

example.introduction: It is often argued that achieving life goals is predominantly a matter of luck. I strongly disagree with this view because personal effort and determination play far more significant roles.
example.body1: The primary reason I disagree is that success requires sustained effort and skill development. Unlike luck, which is random and uncontrollable, hard work can be systematically applied to achieve goals. For instance, self-made entrepreneurs like Elon Musk dedicated countless hours to learning and innovation before achieving success. This clearly demonstrates that deliberate effort trumps fortunate circumstances.
example.body2: Furthermore, perseverance enables individuals to overcome unfavorable conditions. While some people may have fortunate starting points, those who work consistently achieve more lasting success. For example, J.K. Rowling faced poverty and rejection before becoming one of the world's bestselling authors through persistent dedication to her craft.
example.conclusion: In conclusion, I firmly believe that personal effort and determination are the primary drivers of success. While luck may occasionally provide opportunities, only through hard work can individuals truly achieve their life goals.

steps.title: Build Paragraphs
steps.completionCriteria: Complete all 4 paragraphs (10+ words per blank)

content.instructions: Fill in each blank to build your essay paragraph by paragraph. Aim for 10-15 words per blank. Click 'Show Hint' if you need help.

paragraphs.name: Introduction
paragraphs.template: It is often argued that _____ [paraphrase the statement about luck determining success]. I strongly _____ [agree/disagree] with this view because _____ [briefly state your main reason].

blanks.label: Paraphrase the statement
blanks.hint: Reword 'achieving life aims is mostly related to luck' without copying
blanks.placeholder: e.g., success in life is predominantly determined by fortunate circumstances rather than personal effort

blanks.label: Agree or disagree
blanks.hint: Choose: disagree / partially agree / agree (most students disagree)

blanks.label: Your main reason
blanks.hint: Brief explanation of WHY you hold this position
blanks.placeholder: e.g., personal dedication and consistent effort are far more significant factors in determining success

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 1
paragraphs.template: The primary reason for my position is that _____ [state your main argument]. This is because _____ [explain the reasoning]. For instance, _____ [give a specific, concrete example]. As a result, _____ [state the consequence or what this proves].

blanks.label: Main argument
blanks.hint: Your strongest point about why effort matters more than luck
blanks.placeholder: e.g., hard work and perseverance can be systematically developed while luck remains unpredictable and uncontrollable

blanks.label: Explain the reasoning
blanks.hint: WHY does this argument make sense? Explain the mechanism.
blanks.placeholder: e.g., individuals can deliberately cultivate skills, acquire knowledge, and build expertise through consistent practice over time

blanks.label: Specific example
blanks.hint: Use a real person, study, or detailed scenario. Be specific!
blanks.placeholder: e.g., self-made entrepreneurs like Oprah Winfrey overcame poverty and adversity through years of dedicated work to become highly successful

blanks.label: Consequence/what this proves
blanks.hint: What does this example demonstrate about effort vs. luck?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., this clearly demonstrates that sustained personal effort is far more reliable than waiting for fortunate circumstances

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 2
paragraphs.template: Furthermore, _____ [second argument or acknowledge counter-view]. While _____ [acknowledge luck's role briefly], _____ [explain why effort is still more important]. For example, _____ [supporting example]. Therefore, _____ [conclusion].

blanks.label: Second argument or counter-view
blanks.hint: Either another reason supporting your view, or acknowledge luck's role
blanks.placeholder: e.g., determination and strategic planning enable individuals to create opportunities rather than passively waiting for them

blanks.label: Acknowledge luck's role
blanks.hint: Be fair - admit luck can play SOME role
blanks.placeholder: e.g., favorable circumstances may provide initial advantages for some individuals

blanks.label: Why effort is more important
blanks.hint: Counter the luck argument - show effort's superiority
blanks.placeholder: e.g., capitalizing on such opportunities still requires preparation, skill, and the willingness to work persistently toward goals

blanks.label: Supporting example
blanks.hint: Another specific example reinforcing your position
blanks.placeholder: e.g., Olympic athletes achieve excellence not through luck but through countless hours of rigorous training and sacrifice

blanks.label: Conclusion
blanks.hint: Wrap up this paragraph - what does this all prove?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., personal effort remains the decisive factor in achieving meaningful success

paragraphs.name: Conclusion
paragraphs.template: In conclusion, while _____ [acknowledge luck's minor role], I firmly believe that _____ [restate your position with final reasoning or recommendation].

blanks.label: Acknowledge luck's minor role
blanks.hint: One sentence admitting luck exists but is not the main factor
blanks.placeholder: e.g., fortunate circumstances may occasionally influence outcomes to some degree

blanks.label: Restate position + final thought
blanks.hint: Clearly restate YOUR position and add a final insight or implication
blanks.placeholder: e.g., personal dedication, consistent effort, and strategic planning are the primary determinants of whether individuals achieve their life goals

content.instructions: Now combine your paragraphs into a complete essay. You can copy from Step 5 and edit, or write fresh. Aim for 250-280 words total.

introduction.purpose: Paraphrase question + state your clear position

body1.purpose: Present main argument with reasoning and examples

body2.purpose: Present second argument or acknowledge counter-view with examples

conclusion.purpose: Acknowledge luck briefly + firmly restate your position

checklist: Body paragraph 1 presents strong argument about effort with specific example
Body paragraph 2 provides additional support or acknowledges luck briefly
Conclusion acknowledges luck's minor role but firmly restates your position
Specific examples are detailed and relevant

modelEssay.text:
It is often argued that success in life is predominantly determined by fortunate circumstances rather than personal qualities. I strongly disagree with this perspective because individual effort, determination, and strategic planning play far more significant roles in achieving one's goals.

The primary reason for my disagreement is that hard work and perseverance can be systematically developed, whereas luck remains unpredictable and beyond personal control. Individuals can deliberately cultivate skills, acquire specialized knowledge, and build expertise through consistent practice and dedication over extended periods. For instance, self-made entrepreneurs like Oprah Winfrey overcame significant poverty and adversity through years of focused effort to become remarkably successful. Similarly, J.K. Rowling faced homelessness and numerous publisher rejections before her persistence led to creating one of the world's most beloved book series. These examples clearly demonstrate that sustained personal effort proves far more reliable than passively waiting for fortunate circumstances.

Furthermore, determination and strategic planning allow individuals to create opportunities rather than depending on chance. While some people may indeed benefit from favorable starting conditions, capitalizing on any opportunity still requires preparation, skill development, and willingness to work persistently toward objectives. Research by psychologist Angela Duckworth demonstrates that grit and perseverance are stronger predictors of success than natural talent or advantageous circumstances. Olympic athletes, for example, achieve excellence not through luck but through countless hours of rigorous training, sacrifice, and unwavering commitment to improvement.

In conclusion, while fortunate circumstances may occasionally influence outcomes to some degree, I firmly believe that personal dedication, consistent effort, and strategic planning are the primary determinants of whether individuals successfully achieve their life goals.
